stream_context.summary: Kaze codes and designs the Power Plant interior of the Oil Level, debugging moving platforms, planning collectible placement, and brainstorming two new enemies (a redesigned Amp and a psychedelic “Oil Fuzzy”). He also discusses recent engine optimisations, graphics/texture needs, and future demo plans.

development_findings.summary: A moving-elevator platform in the Power Plant failed because a duplicate, overlapping copy existed and collision was missing; removing the duplicate and adding collision fixed it.
development_findings.quote: What if there were two of the exact same platform in the exact same spot overlapping each other—and that's why it didn't work.

development_findings.summary: Current FPS improvements: after inlining small functions, engine performance rose from ~43–45 fps to 45–49 fps (now ~47 fps after a culling fix); Kaze is running out of “big” optimisations.
development_findings.quote: We're slowly getting to a point where I no longer know any more optimisations which is crazy.

development_findings.summary: First Power Plant room layout: treadmill start, vertical pipes, sliding ramps, and a dangling platform that you pull down to reach a Yoshi Coin early, so players don’t have to replay half the star if they miss it.
Initial idea for breakable crates/barrels was dropped; collectible will instead use the dangling-platform gimmick. Crates may still appear as scenery.
Dynamic lighting plan: new Amp enemies will emit light, briefly illuminating nearby vertices as they travel along pipes and gates.
Amp redesign: switch to Odyssey-style grey sphere with animated electric spikes (pyramids that scale, fade, and randomly roll); several will spline along metal tracks in the Power Plant.

Concepted a new enemy, the “Oil Fuzzy”: touching it causes a full-screen psychedelic wobble (FOV oscillation, viewport sine shift, rainbow fog/water), audio slow-down, extreme squash-and-stretch, and uncontrollable sliding. No direct damage; danger comes from environment.
development_findings.quote: The level is gonna glow in rainbow colors, the whole viewport is gonna go… Mario's gonna be super squashy and stretchy—it's gonna feel uncontrollable.

development_findings.summary: Evaluated removing polygonal transition graphics and regenerating them from SVG at load-time; savings estimated at ~9 KB ROM, judged probably not worth the complexity.
Textures for this area are placeholders until Biobak delivers final art; Kaze is hesitant to commit vibe-critical elements without those textures.
Kaze intends to release one or two small, topical demo hacks before RTYI to finalise camera & physics and ensure financial viability.
development_findings.quote: Before RTYI's release, I do want to release one or two more demos where people can just play-test the physics and stuff.

context_findings.summary: Kaze finds constant questions about release dates frustrating and wishes streams without them.
context_findings.quote: I hope we can go a whole stream without people asking me for release dates every 15 minutes.

context_findings.summary: He recently moved and now works from a basement; Zeina occupies the upstairs, a running joke about being ‘out of his hair’.
context_findings.quote: Zeina is finally out of my hair—she is upstairs now and I'm downstairs—isn't that nice.

context_findings.summary: Audience composition shifted toward programmers after the source-code rework; technical content now outperforms casual content.
context_findings.quote: I feel like a lot of programmers watch my channel now and not so much the casual audience ever since the source code revert.

context_findings.summary: Financial incentive strongly influences project choice (e.g., won’t remaster Ocarina of Time without funding; wants ‘click-bait’ hacks pre-release).
context_findings.quote: I would like to do OOT next but I need financial incentive—I can't just do it, it would be irresponsible.

context_findings.summary: Kaze is under NDA at Gears for Breakfast and cannot talk about what he’s working on there.
context_findings.quote: I am not allowed to tell what I am working on—I'm still actively working there.

biobak.summary: Responsible for final textures in the Power Plant; current area will remain ‘ugly’ until Biobak polishes it.
biobak.quote: I guess this whole area is gonna be ugly until Biobak gets to it.

biobak.summary: Fixed geometric issues with polygonal shadows/transitions and supplied early Amp graphics for Kaze to review.

zeina.summary: No development input this stream; playful separation joke (she forbids Kaze from coming upstairs).
zeina.quote: She said I am never allowed to come upstairs—and then she punched me.

key_stories.title: The Phantom Platform
key_stories.summary: A newly scripted elevator wouldn’t move. Through systematic checks Kaze discovered a duplicate platform occupying the same coordinates and lacking collision data.
key_stories.challenge: Elevator platform failed to displace Mario.
key_stories.process: Verified platform displacement globally, checked tick functions, hypothesised duplicate objects, inspected scene, removed extra instance, added collision.
key_stories.key_quote: What if there were two of the exact same platform in the exact same spot overlapping each other—that's why it didn't work.

key_stories.title: Inventing the Oil Fuzzy
key_stories.summary: Kaze brainstorms a unique enemy that mixes Yoshi’s Island nostalgia with new mechanics, experimenting live with matrix hacks to create a psychedelic visual filter.
key_stories.challenge: Create an enemy mechanic that feels fresh and fits an oil-powered factory theme.
key_stories.process: Tested viewport matrix manipulations, hue shifts, FOV pulsations; decided on rainbow fog, slippery physics and audio warping triggered by contact.
key_stories.outcome: Clear design spec for ‘Oil Fuzzy’ to prototype next stream.
key_stories.key_quote: The level is gonna glow in rainbow colors, the whole viewport is gonna go… Mario's gonna be super squashy and stretchy—it's gonna feel uncontrollable.

key_stories.title: Chasing Every Frame
key_stories.summary: Over the week Kaze squeezed more performance from the engine by inlining small functions, pushing typical scenes close to 49 fps.
key_stories.challenge: Maintain stable high framerate in complex new areas.
key_stories.process: Profiled code, inlined and removed minor functions, adjusted culling.
key_stories.outcome: Jump from ~43 fps to peak 49 fps; only small gains remain.
key_stories.key_quote: We're slowly getting to a point where I no longer know any more optimisations which is crazy.
